intro: Centaurea denticulata, commonly known as the toothed centaurea, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often hairy as well. Centaurea denticulata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
